title: Odpověď ze stejné identity bez nutnosti přepínání.
content: Dobrý den, nevím si rady jak nastavit, aby má odpověď na email, odešel ze stejné identity, jako původní zpráva. Příklad - mám v Thunderbirdu 2 identity, z nichž jedna je primární a tu používám převážně. Někdy však potřebuji odeslat email z té sekundární identiny, když mi pak přijde odpově a chci na ni zase odpověď, potřebuji, aby se odeslala z té původní (sekundární) identity, aniž bych je musel přepínat. Takto na to totiž neustále zapomínám. Kolega rovněž používá Thunderbird a tohle mu funguje, jak potřebuji. Funguje mu takto, aniž býval musel měnit něco v nastavení. Předem díky moc za pomoc. LD

title: Compacting request repeats endlessly - something is corrupted
content:
TB 102.8.0.

Since December 2022, compacting is not working properly. I have set TB to ask me whether to compact when 100 MB would be saved. This has worked fine for years. Since December, I receive a pop-up advising that 237 MB or slightly more can be saved. After compacting, the message repeats every hour or two.

Compacting is actually, working except for the 237 MB chunk of data that either can't be compacted or doesn't really exist and fools TB into thinking compaction is needed. For example, if I set the compaction threshold to 500 MB then the mailbox will grow and I will eventually receive a reminder to compact when more than 500 MB can be saved. Compacting at that point does indeed shrink the mailbox. But, immediately thereafter, if I set the threshold back to 100 MB I get a message that 237 MB can be saved by compacting. Thus, the compact request repeats endlessly, all day long.

Technical details can be found here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1791354

I can't take it any more. Does anyone have a suggestion for forcing TB to re-examine or re-index my inbox in a manner that correctly determines its size and ends this nuisance?

Thanks.
creator: mgoldey

title: Vanishing Email messages
content:
Linux Mint 17.2 Thunderbird 60.6.1

I've been a Thunderbird user for 10+ years and am generally satisfied. in the past week I have experienced a mysterious malfunction.

I routinely exchange Email messages with a close friend. I now have an outgoing message which is /never/ delivered. It doesn't appear in her Junk folder. It doesn't bounce back to me. It simply disappears! Other messages to the same friend get through in seconds.

I can send this same message three times in a row. None get through. Reboot my desktop, same thing. Three sends, nothing received.

The following day, same thing. Three sends, nothing received. Then I make one change: add my own Eddress to the destination list. Now she and I both promptly receive the message.

The Email consists of routine chit-chat. It has no attachments, no graphics, no emojis. It contains no URLs. It is plain text, not HTML.

Daniel B. Martin
creator: danielbmartin

title: condivisione "cartelle locali" di thunderbird in rete: è possibile / sconsigliabile ecc?
content: Bungiorno e grazie del tempo dedicatomi, se potete collaborare. Ho uno studio con 3 professionisti; a rotazione ciascuno usa solo e sempre la propria postazione, e mai sono presenti contemporaneamente: cioè quando 1 pc è acceso gli altri sono sempre spenti. Ciascuno ha la propria posta in imap configurata correttamente (non gmail), ma avrebbero bisogno di una cartella locale condivisa, per lo storico, utile per la consultazione di tutti e per l'archiviazione di ciascuna pratica; stiamo parlando di 86 giga divise in 124 cartelle di progetti (con allegati, ovvio)... non ci penso a mettere in imap anche quella... Avevo pensato di condividere una cartella sul server di rete locale e di infilarci dentro le cartelle locali, ma... che voi sappiate è possibile dire a tb di usare una cartella Mail/Local Folders che non sia quella di default? solo per non fare disastri... ho provato così: raggruppato in locale le mail x argomento, esportato un singolo argomento (con 1000) mail) in mbox, eliminate da cartelle locali (x recuperare spazio), messo le mbox in rete, poi aprirle dal tb: funziona bene (e si possono anche consultare in contemporanea), ma non posso ovviamente aggiornarle... con l'altro sistema sarebbe anche un poco più pratico. grazie e scusate la lungaggine; buon lavoro a tutti.
creator: marino_negro

title: Microsoft Exchange/MS 365 Enterprise client configuration in 108+
content:
My MS Exchange connection stopped working in 102.8 due to the changes in OAUTH2 in that release (I found them described here: https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/yqwes1/notice_to_microsoft_office_365_enterprise_users/) . I was using an application-specific password prior to this and it worked well.

In 102.8, I got the MS pop-up message to re-authenticate and I did so, using my regular MS password (the application specific password was rejected by the MS authentication). Completing this popup and 2FA then generated a message to my IT Admin to approve Thunderbird and they have done so. However, Im still getting the authentication message each time I try to connect. I also exited TB and restarted and there is no difference. So, I have these questions: - Is there anything I need to do on the client side to configure for the new OAUTH2 (my IMAP server setting is SSL/TLS and OAUTH2) - Is all the admin has to do is approve the app? (Ive confirmed with them that they have done this although I did not give a confirmation email as the MS popup says that I would). - Any other ideas or suggestions? Is there an "official" page for guiding setup of TB for MS accounts? Thanks!

title: Quero parar de receber cópias (na ciaxa de "Entrada") das mensagens que envio via Webmail.
content:
Descrevendo melhor o problema.

1. Tenho várias contas do Gmail no Thunderbird.

O problema: - Vou no webmail (uso o Firefox) logo na conta (Gmail) e escrevo uma nova mensagem. - Envio para qualquer e-mail. - A mensagem vai normalmente: chega na conta destino (caixa de Entrada). Fica registrada na caixa Enviados da conta remetente. Chega também na caixa de Entrada da conta remetente (no Thunderbird). - Não chegam cópias das mensagens nas caixas de Entrada da conta remetente no Webmail.

Quando redijo qualquer mensagem no Thunderbird (usando qualquer das contas Gmail), o problema não ocorre.

Já fucei nas configurações tanto no Gmail quanto no Thunderbird e não encontrei solução.

Também já fucei no help do Gmail e não encontrei solução.

Sei que parece confuso, mas, se desenharem num papel, vai dar para entender a descrição do problema.

Alguém poderia me dar uma luz? Grato, Ivens

I understand it may be harder to implement in an application versus in a website like Gmail and Microsoft Outlook currently have but my Outlook client also has had the ability to delete emails on the email line also em Client has had this option as well.

I like and prefer to use Thunderbird for my Gmail account but this is one thing that is a constant annoyances and consumes extra time to have to open each email before I am able to delete it.

title: Strange HTML incoming message
content:
This has happened several times recently: a message shows up in my Inbox, supposedly from "x" person or organization...but the message body is not only in HTML, but it's from a DIFFERENT person or organization! I've tried restarting T'bird, but same thing happens...view is set to "Original HTML" as my default.

I won't clog up this message with the hundreds of lines of HTML that are in the message body, but here's the latest example: T'bird shows the message as coming from National Geographic, with the subject line of "Crippling disease often not diagnosed." However, the HTML indicates it's from OneDrive, with these first lines: 

                   Hi Joan,                    

                    We noticed that you recently deleted a large number of files from your OneDrive.                    

                    When files are deleted, they are moved to your OneDrive recycle bin. If you don't restore deleted files from the OneDrive recycle bin, they are permanently deleted after 30 days.                    

                    If you want to restore these files, go to the <a alias="Inline:OneDriveRecycleBin" href="https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=857494" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; color: #0078d6;"><b semibold="" style="font-weight: normal;font-family: 'Segoe UI Semibold', 'Segoe UI', SUWSB, Arial, sans-serif;color: #0078d6">OneDrive recycle bin</a>, select what you want to restore, and click the Restore button.                    

                    You can ignore this mail if you meant to get rid of these files.

Any idea what's going on???

title: suggestion:  Give TBird update, implicit priority over downloading messages
content:
Context: 

  [] I have another email  site, with alot of email messages in it;   [] I was seeking  a Sync/DoNotSync icon, since I did NOT want to keep downloading messages,      as it is MORE important to me (at least in this circumstance, if not always, for security reasons)      to get the TBird Update, as a priority over downloading messages. 
 [] Not finding the Sync/noSync icon, I instead tried File.OfflineModal Icon, whatever that was...;     But that BOTH a) stopped message download (good), b) stopped the Update !! 
 [] Clearly, the TBird Update, for security reasons is more critical....      But know that some people may think downloading messages more critical.

Action requested: 

 [] make the WorkOffline mode, allow wither case a) or b) above, not both ! 
 []  I had Settings to autocheck for downloads, and notifications set to sound      In my case above, this lead to essentiall infininte sounds.. not knowing where they were comming from.      AND  the download window just sat there spinning, but not downloading.

title: Third party application sends emails. Not captured by sent folder.
content: Third party application(NAPA Tracs) changed their email method to send using their own email send via IMAP using Microsoft 365 servers. Email goes to the targeted recipient, and a copy goes to sent mail folder in Microsoft 365 web based email sent folder. Thunderbird no longer retrieves/receives a copy of that sent mail to place it in it's sent mail folder. That third party switched its logic with the latest release in Feb 2023 to stop sending using Thunderbird directly and send to the 365 IMAP server. Until that time all email sent by third party were captured in the Thunderbird sent folder.
creator: DonInfoSys
